channel.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
channel.description:
Okay so after port forwarding correctly and you try and connect to your no-ip isn't it supposed to say error connecting for you but for others let them login?
Well for me it doesn't it lets me login with localhost, 127.0.0.1, and my no-ip but doesn't let anyone else login? I am beginning to get more and more confused I have changed all the ip's in client.java and I don't have a gui.java or egui.java and since there are no ips to change server sided (client.java,server.java) I don't know what to do. I am able to connect perfectly but others can't?
Any ideas guys? Also sorry if i posted in wrong section not sure if it is client or server sided problem. :confused: :confused: :confused:

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
item.dc:creator: @TpK_Dons TpK Dons™
item.description:
@TpK_Dons wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

It matters 127.0.0.1 is the ip which only you can connect to from your computer no one else change all the 127.0.0.1 to your no-ip in client.java by CTRL + F or CTRL + H search server or server= when done save and compile then rejar the client and upload it to your website again then they should be able to login

Ty so much man I have been looking for this answer for about 4 days str9 finally got it working

Read full topic

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

It matters 127.0.0.1 is the ip which only you can connect to from your computer no one else change all the 127.0.0.1 to your no-ip in client.java by CTRL + F or CTRL + H search server or server= when done save and compile then rejar the client and upload it to your website again then they should be able to login

Read full topic

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
item.dc:creator: @TpK_Dons TpK Dons™
item.description:
@TpK_Dons wrote:

yeah it was I didn’t think it mattered as long as I changed after in client.java then compiled but thanks I haven’t heared that yet so I will give it a try ty

Read full topic

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

oops you made it seem like it was a downloadable client. If they are able to load the webclient to the login screen then my last guess would be when you made the jar the ip might have been still set as localhost? that’s why they are not able to connect to your webclient

Read full topic

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
item.dc:creator: @TpK_Dons TpK Dons™
item.description:
@TpK_Dons wrote:

I have checked canyouseeme.org about 10 times already and also used the port checker tool at runelocus.

What do you mean by “they have not edited the run.bat to their version of java so it won’t open the client?”

I am the host so they shouldn’t have to because I already am running it and btw they are using the webclient that I made and I know it’s not that because everything loads fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

you use 127.0.0.1 others use the no-ip maybe your ports are not open check at canyouseeme.org or they have not edited the run.bat to their version of java so it won’t open the client?

Read full topic

item.title: Isn't this a bit weird?

item.description:
@TpK_Dons wrote:

Okay so after port forwarding correctly and you try and connect to your no-ip isn’t it supposed to say error connecting for you but for others let them login?

Well for me it doesn’t it lets me login with localhost, 127.0.0.1, and my no-ip but doesn’t let anyone else login? I am beginning to get more and more confused I have changed all the ip’s in client.java and I don’t have a gui.java or egui.java and since there are no ips to change server sided (client.java,server.java) I don’t know what to do. I am able to connect perfectly but others can’t?

Any ideas guys? Also sorry if i posted in wrong section not sure if it is client or server sided problem.
